snippet: In a lawsuit against the United States Tennis Association, Bouchard said that her fall at the United States Open was the result of “a slippery, foreign and dangerous substance on the floor.”
abstract: Eugenie Bouchard files lawsuit against United States Tennis Assn and Billie Jean King National Tennis Center for damages related to head injury she sustained when she slipped on floor, which forced her to withdraw from United States Open tennis tournament.

keywords.value: Billie Jean King National Tennis Center
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: In a lawsuit against the United States Tennis Association, Bouchard said that her fall at the United States Open was the result of “a slippery, foreign and dangerous substance on the floor.”

headline.print_headline: Bouchard Sues Over Head Injury From Fall at U.S. Open
headline.main: Eugenie Bouchard Sues Over Injuries From Fall at U.S. Open
